aria-allowed-role-1.title: Uses ARIA roles on incompatible elements
aria-allowed-role-1.description: Many HTML elements can only be assigned certain ARIA roles. Using ARIA roles where they are not allowed can interfere with the accessibility of the web page. [Learn more about ARIA roles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-allowed-role).

items.snippet: <label id="mw-sidebar-button" class="mw-checkbox-hack-button mw-ui-icon mw-ui-button mw-ui-quiet mw-ui-icon-ele…" for="mw-sidebar-checkbox" role="button" aria-controls="mw-panel" data-event-name="ui.sidebar" tabindex="0">
items.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  ARIA role button is not allowed for given element

items.snippet: <input type="checkbox" id="p-personal-checkbox" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" data-event-name="ui.dropdown-p-personal" class="vector-menu-checkbox">
items.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  ARIA role button is not allowed for given element

color-contrast-2.title: Background and foreground colors do not have a sufficient contrast ratio.
color-contrast-2.description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. [Learn how to provide sufficient color contrast](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/color-contrast).

items.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Element has insufficient color contrast of 4.25 (foreground color: #dd3333, background color: #faf5ff, font size: 8.9pt (11.9px), font weight: bold). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1

definition-list-3.title: `<dl>`'s do not contain only properly-ordered `<dt>` and `<dd>` groups, `<script>`, `<template>` or `<div>` elements.
definition-list-3.description: When definition lists are not properly marked up, screen readers may produce confusing or inaccurate output. [Learn how to structure definition lists correctly](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/definition-list).

items.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  When not empty, element does not have at least one <dt> element followed by at least one <dd> element

link-name-4.title: Links do not have a discernible name
link-name-4.description: Link text (and alternate text for images, when used as links) that is discernible, unique, and focusable improves the navigation experience for screen reader users. [Learn how to make links accessible](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/link-name).

items.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  Element is in tab order and does not have accessible text

Fix any of the following:
  Element does not have text that is visible to screen readers
  aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
  aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
  Element has no title attribute

target-size-5.title: Touch targets do not have sufficient size or spacing.
target-size-5.description: Touch targets with sufficient size and spacing help users who may have difficulty targeting small controls to activate the targets. [Learn more about touch targets](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/target-size).

items.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Target has insufficient size (98.8px by 16px, should be at least 24px by 24px)
  Target has insufficient space to its closest neighbors. Safe clickable space has a diameter of 23.6px instead of at least 24px.

Fix any of the following:
  Target has insufficient size (100.4px by 16px, should be at least 24px by 24px)
  Target has insufficient space to its closest neighbors. Safe clickable space has a diameter of 23.6px instead of at least 24px.

  Target has insufficient space to its closest neighbors. Safe clickable space has a diameter of 23.8px instead of at least 24px.

  Target has insufficient space to its closest neighbors. Safe clickable space has a diameter of 21.2px instead of at least 24px.

table-fake-caption-6.title: Tables do not use `<caption>` instead of cells with the `[colspan]` attribute to indicate a caption.
table-fake-caption-6.description: Screen readers have features to make navigating tables easier. Ensuring that tables use the actual caption element instead of cells with the `[colspan]` attribute may improve the experience for screen reader users. [Learn more about captions](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/table-fake-caption).

items.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  The first child of the table should be a caption instead of a table cell

items.snippet: <table cellspacing="0" class="nowraplinks collapsible autocollapse" style="width:100%;margin-bottom: 0px; background:transparent; color:inherit;;">
items.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  The first child of the table should be a caption instead of a table cell

td-has-header-7.title: `<td>` elements in a large `<table>` do not have table headers.
td-has-header-7.description: Screen readers have features to make navigating tables easier. Ensuring that `<td>` elements in a large table (3 or more cells in width and height) have an associated table header may improve the experience for screen reader users. [Learn more about table headers](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/td-has-header).

items.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  Some non-empty data cells do not have table headers
